description: At approximately 2:30 PM, the city of San Miguel experienced a series of aftershocks from the San Miguel Fault Line, causing further damage to the already devastated city.

A1_ppt_ground_shaken.name: San Miguel Fault Line
A1_ppt_ground_shaken.desc: The San Miguel Fault Line is a major fault line that runs directly beneath the city of San Miguel. It has been relatively dormant for many years, with minor tremors being the only indication of its existence. However, the recent 6.1 magnitude earthquake has brought it to the forefront of public attention, causing widespread devastation and panic in the city.

AM_loc.name: San Miguel
AM_loc.desc: San Miguel is a bustling city in a developing country, known for its vibrant markets, historical landmarks, and dense population. The city has been growing rapidly, with many people moving in from rural areas in search of better opportunities.

description: At approximately 3:15 PM, the San Miguel Fault Line, which runs directly beneath the city of San Miguel, experienced a significant shift. This shift resulted in the formation of seismic waves, causing a 6.1 magnitude earthquake that shook the city to its core.

A1_ppt_ground_shaken.name: San Miguel Fault Line
A1_ppt_ground_shaken.desc: The San Miguel Fault Line is a major fault line that runs directly beneath the city of San Miguel. It has been relatively dormant for many years, with minor tremors being the only indication of its existence. However, the recent 6.1 magnitude earthquake has brought it to the forefront of public attention, causing widespread devastation and panic in the city.

A3_vsp_death/injury_toll.name: Carlos Mendoza
A3_vsp_death/injury_toll.desc: Carlos Mendoza is a 32-year-old street vendor who moved to San Miguel from a rural village five years ago. He is known for his friendly demeanor and hardworking nature, selling fresh fruits and vegetables in one of the city's busiest markets.

A4_vsp_damages/cost.name: The San Miguel Catastrophe
A4_vsp_damages/cost.desc: The San Miguel Catastrophe refers to the extensive losses and damages caused by the San Miguel Quake. The catastrophe resulted in numerous casualties, widespread property damage, and significant disruption to the city's infrastructure and services. The aftermath of the catastrophe has left the city in a state of emergency, with many residents displaced and in need of aid.

AM_loc.name: San Miguel
AM_loc.desc: San Miguel is a bustling city in a developing country, known for its vibrant markets, historical landmarks, and dense population. The city has been growing rapidly, with many people moving in from rural areas in search of better opportunities.

description: During the San Miguel Quake, Carlos Mendoza was severely injured when his fruit stand collapsed on him due to the violent shaking. Despite his injuries, he managed to crawl out from under the debris, but was later rushed to the hospital due to internal bleeding.

A1_ppt_experiencer_injured_party.name: Carlos Mendoza

description: At approximately 2:15 PM, Carlos Mendoza, a beloved local fruit vendor, tragically lost his life due to the severe injuries he sustained during the San Miguel Quake. His fruit stand, located in one of the city's busiest markets, collapsed on him during the violent shaking, causing internal bleeding.

AM_cau__cause.name: The San Miguel Quake
AM_cau__cause.desc: The San Miguel Quake was a devastating 6.1 magnitude earthquake that struck the city of San Miguel, causing widespread destruction and panic. The quake was particularly destructive due to the city's location on the San Miguel Fault Line, and it has brought the previously dormant fault line to the forefront of public attention.

description: In the aftermath of the San Miguel Quake, thousands of residents, including Maria Lopez and her two young children, were left homeless. Their homes, like many others, were reduced to rubble, leaving them with no choice but to seek shelter in makeshift camps set up by local authorities and international aid organizations.

A0_pag_mover.name: The San Miguel Quake

A1_ppt_moved.name: Maria Lopez
A1_ppt_moved.desc: Maria Lopez is a 28-year-old nurse who has lived in San Miguel her entire life. Known for her dedication and compassion, she works at a local clinic and is deeply involved in her community. Maria is a single mother of two young children, balancing her demanding job with the responsibilities of parenthood.

AM_cau__cause.name: The San Miguel Quake

The quake was particularly destructive due to the city's location on the San Miguel Fault Line, and it has brought the previously dormant fault line to the forefront of public attention.

description: On January 5, 2030, Carlos Mendoza, a 32-year-old street vendor, tragically succumbed to his injuries sustained during the San Miguel Quake. Despite his initial survival and rescue from the debris of his collapsed fruit stand, his internal injuries proved too severe, leading to his untimely death.

description: The San Miguel Quake, a 6.1 magnitude earthquake, caused extensive damage to the city's infrastructure on January 6, 2030. Buildings crumbled, roads were torn apart, and the city's largest hospital, San Miguel Central Hospital, was severely damaged, straining its resources and capacity.

A0_pag_agent.name: The San Miguel Quake
A0_pag_agent.desc: The San Miguel Quake was a devastating 6.1 magnitude earthquake that struck the city of San Miguel, causing widespread destruction and panic. The quake was particularly destructive due to the city's location on the San Miguel Fault Line, and it has brought the previously dormant fault line to the forefront of public attention.

A1_ppt_entity_damaged.name: San Miguel Central Hospital
A1_ppt_entity_damaged.desc: San Miguel Central Hospital is the largest hospital in the city, providing a wide range of medical services to the residents of San Miguel. The hospital was severely damaged in the San Miguel Quake, leading to a significant strain on its resources and capacity. Despite the challenges, the hospital staff, led by Dr. Luis Fernandez, continue to work tirelessly to treat the injured and sick, often in makeshift wards and operating rooms.

A2_mnr_instrument.name: The San Miguel Quake
A2_mnr_instrument.desc: The San Miguel Quake was a devastating 6.1 magnitude earthquake that struck the city of San Miguel, causing widespread destruction and panic. The quake was particularly destructive due to the city's location on the San Miguel Fault Line, and it has brought the previously dormant fault line to the forefront of public attention.

AM_loc.name: San Miguel Fault Line
AM_loc.desc: The San Miguel Fault Line is a major fault line that runs directly beneath the city of San Miguel. It has been relatively dormant for many years, with minor tremors being the only indication of its existence. However, the recent 6.1 magnitude earthquake has brought it to the forefront of public attention, causing widespread devastation and panic in the city.

description: At 10:30 AM, Diego Alvarez and his rescue squad were dispatched to a collapsed apartment building in the heart of San Miguel, where they worked tirelessly to extricate survivors from the debris. Meanwhile, Maria Lopez, despite her own home being damaged, rushed to the local clinic to provide medical aid to the injured.

A0_pag_rescuer.name: Diego Alvarez
A0_pag_rescuer.desc: Diego Alvarez is a 40-year-old firefighter and team leader of the local rescue squad in San Miguel. Known for his bravery and quick decision-making, Diego has been a firefighter for over 15 years and has extensive experience in emergency response and rescue operations.

A1_ppt_entity_rescued.name: Maria Lopez

description: At 2:00 PM, Dr. Luis Fernandez and nurse Maria Lopez, along with their medical team, began providing emergency medical assistance to the victims of the San Miguel Catastrophe at a makeshift medical center set up by SMEMS.

A0_pag_causer_doctor.name: Dr. Luis Fernandez
A0_pag_causer_doctor.desc: Dr. Luis Fernandez is a 38-year-old emergency medicine physician with a decade of experience working in high-stress environments. He is known for his quick thinking, calm demeanor, and ability to handle multiple critical cases simultaneously. Dr. Fernandez moved to San Miguel three years ago to work at the city's main hospital, where he has become a respected figure among his colleagues and patients.

A3_mnr__instrument_treatment.name: San Miguel Emergency Medical Supplies (SMEMS)
A3_mnr__instrument_treatment.desc: San Miguel Emergency Medical Supplies (SMEMS) is a temporary organization set up in the aftermath of the San Miguel Quake. It is responsible for the procurement, storage, and distribution of emergency medical supplies to hospitals, clinics, and makeshift medical centers throughout the city. SMEMS works closely with local and international aid organizations to ensure that the city's medical needs are met during this crisis.

description: On January 10, 2030, Javier Morales and Laura Castillo, both seasoned media relations specialists, coordinated with local and national media outlets to disseminate accurate and timely information about the earthquake crisis in San Miguel.

A0_pag_organizer.name: Javier Morales
A0_pag_organizer.desc: Javier Morales is a 38-year-old media relations specialist with a background in journalism and crisis communication. He has worked for several major news outlets before transitioning to a role in public relations for the National Disaster Response Agency. Known for his calm demeanor and quick thinking, Javier is responsible for coordinating with local and national media outlets to ensure accurate and timely information is disseminated during the earthquake crisis.

A1_ppt_entity_coordinated.desc: Laura Castillo is a 36-year-old media liaison with a background in journalism and public relations.
